campaign.story:
Switch between handheld and tripod modes (and back again) in seconds.  
Filming yourself is not easy. You’re often on the go with tons of people looking at you like you’re crazy while you hold a camera in your face. You’re used to the weird looks and eye rolls, but don't you wish your handheld tripod wasn’t so clunky?  
We’ve designed something better. Meet SwitchPod. 
SwitchPod is lightweight, compact, and nearly indestructible. It will save you time between shots so you can focus more on shooting and less on messing with your gear. 
"From vlog mode to tripod mode IN SECONDS." - Peter McKinnon 
"I'm never using my Gorillapod ever again." - Levi Allen VanderKwaak 
"This is such a sturdy tripod... It's the only way to vlog. Seriously, it is THE tripod for vloggers." - Dave Altizer of Kinotika
SwitchPod works with any camera. No more fussing with tripod mounting plates, our embedded 1/4-20" standard tripod screw and tightening knob will help you attach any camera in seconds. 
Opens and closes quickly.  Move easily from shot to shot and waste no time setting up. Magnets help to keep the legs collapsed together while in vlogging mode, but are gentle enough that, with the flick of your wrist, you can easily switch to tripod mode.
Easy to hold. Finger grooves allow you to grip the SwitchPod at your comfort level anywhere along the neck. If your camera is heavy, choke up. If it’s light, slide down. 
Non-slip feet. Discreet, recessed feet allow you to set your camera down quietly on a surface without it sliding away.  
Quickly attach or remove your camera. The tightening knob allows you to switch cameras swiftly while ensuring that any camera is safely attached.  
Take it anywhere. The thin and lightweight design allows you to easily slip it into any camera bag, pocket, or fanny pack (if you’re THAT cool).    
Easily slide it into bags & pockets.
Use a carabiner to quickly clip it anywhere.
Strong enough to hold heavy rigs and won’t sag. Despite its lightweight design, the SwitchPod is incredibly strong and made of an aluminum alloy (not plastic). It will support a heavy camera, lens, microphone, and more without breaking or slowly collapsing. 
The SwitchPod easily holding 100 pounds (and not being crushed to death!)
Add your own quick release plates or ball heads. Have a bunch of tripods with the same quick release adapters? Modify the SwitchPod by adding your own quick release plate. Need a ball head? You can add that too.  
Accessorize. Use the two ¼-20" threads on the legs to add a mic, a monitor, an LED light, or your Hello Kitty keychain.
Ready to Roll. Turn your SwitchPod into a full video rig! (Note: We tried attaching a fax machine as well, but cable management was too much of a pain.) 
 Weight: 11.1 oz / 315 grams
 Material: Aluminum (Alloy)
 Length in Collapsed Handle Mode: 11" long
 Size of Handle: 1.5" deep by 0.75" wide
 Size in Tripod Mode: 9.75" tall by 9.75" wide
 Color: Black
 Two ¼-20 threads for accessories
 Circle pad to protect base of camera
 Patent Pending 
“You can have in any color as long as it is black." - Henry Ford 
No, but really. Just black. Keepin’ it discreet, keepin’ it classic. We’re making just one size and one color for this first batch.
It's even better in slow motion, right?
While attending a conference in late 2017 we noticed how many YouTubers and vloggers were walking around, using an item not meant for vlogging. We’d watch over and over again as people struggled to transition between holding their camera out in front of them and setting it down on a flat surface. What they were using was cumbersome, time consuming, and honestly, kinda hard to watch. 
We thought to ourselves, “There’s got to be an easier way”. 
But there wasn’t. So over the next 14 months we invented SwitchPod. 
Since the initial idea, we’ve spent just over a year creating and testing prototypes, getting feedback from people who vlog all the time at events like VidCon and VidSummit, and fine tuning every feature meticulously into the final matte black, metallic prototype.
What started as crude sketches turned into CAD drawings. Then 3D printed models we could actually hold and eventually into working tripods.
We’ve tried different lightweight materials, hand grip sizes, mechanisms for keeping the legs in place, knobs for attaching your camera, and more. 
Here's a sample of all the prototypes we've been working on.
Every detail and feature has evolved over the last year into the product we originally dreamed of creating.
We have completed our final design changes, selected our suppliers, have worked with the same manufacturers on our 4 final prototypes, and have our supply chain in place. 
Once this campaign is funded we will place the order for the molds to be created and the manufacturing will begin.
In order to make them perfect and not rush through the process, we’re estimating 4 to 5 months until final delivery, which should be August or September 2019. 
Pat Flynn & Caleb Wojcik
Pat and Caleb are both entrepreneurs and have been running online businesses for over 15 years combined.
Pat Flynn is best known for his blog and podcast Smart Passive Income, where he conducts income experiments and shares the results. 
Caleb Wojcik runs a video production company and teaches creators how to make better videos through his YouTube channel and online courses. 
They’ve worked together for over 5 years, during which they’ve launched online courses, digital products, books, and filmed a ton of YouTube videos. They both live in San Diego.
If you know someone specific or have an audience that would be interested in hearing about SwitchPod, we would love your help sharing this campaign with them. Thank you in advance!
For press inquiries about SwitchPod or this Kickstarter campaign please email pr@switchpod.co. Or download our media kit including photos, GIFs, videos, branding, and more below.
There are a bunch of people we’d love to thank that helped us turn our idea for SwitchPod into a reality. 
First off, the team over at Prouduct. Thiefaine Magre, Richie Norton, Jase Bennett, and Cole Chamberlain. For their support, advice, expertise, and hard work from day one. Thank you.
Second, to all the people that saw early prototypes in person and gave us valuable feedback and recommendations. Levi VanderKwaak, Greg Farnum, Caleb Pike, Armando Ferreira, Casey Neistat, Peter McKinnon, Thomas Frank, Charli Prangley, Roberto Blake, Kitty Peters, Jason Vong, Dave Altizer, Connor McCaskill, Robert Campbell,Ben Sullins and anyone else we forgot to mention! 
Third, our own team. Jen Wojcik, thank you for all the hard work on photos and other parts of this launch. And Tim Krupa, thank you all your help with editing and for always being a sounding board for good (and bad) ideas. 
Make the switch.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are each successful business owners and are dedicated to bringing this to our backers as quickly as possible. All that being said. Sometimes things happen that are out of our control. And while we have alllll our fingers and toes crossed that the manufacturing and shipping process goes as smoothly as possible, if things do go wonky, we promise to keep you in the loop.

Supply Chain Risks: We’re working with an amazing engineering and manufacturing team that has brought many products to market, but things can happen, even with experts involved. Sometimes machines break. Sometimes the factory loses power. Sometimes the timeline isn’t totally in our hands and things can take longer than we’d hoped. 

Shipping Risks: Weather is a thing guys. It can affect timelines. So can port closures and other uncontrollable factors. We’re willing to blow up a raft with a foot pump (not our mouths, we’re not savages) and paddle out to get boxes, but no promises that’ll speed up the process. 

Acts of God: We’re based in San Diego. We’re prone to wildfires and earthquakes. Fingers crossed that if the San Andreas fault busts open and we don’t make it, the SwitchPods do. (Or The Rock saves them all.)

campaign.story:
It’s time to let go of what’s holding you back—so you can let in what’s waiting for you on the other side.
Welcome & Thank You
Hey there! I’m Pat Flynn, and I’d like to invite you to celebrate the launch of the first ever hardcover, print edition of my book Let Go.
Most of us live life within a series of prescribed plans that help us decide what to do and where to go next.
We go to school. Get good grades. Get a job. Climb the corporate ladder. 
Rung, after rung, after rung.
And the higher up you go, the more committed you become to that path because, well—you've already climbed so far, and the fall is a lot longer from up there.
But what happens when your plans change or you become unhappy with the path that you're on? How easy it is to change your path?
Creating a new path in life is one of the hardest things anyone can do. I know from personal experience:
On June 17, 2008—exactly 10 years ago—I was kicked off of my own ladder. I was laid off from my dream job as an architect.
It was one of the worst days of my life, but looking back, it was a huge blessing in disguise.
It turned out to be the best thing that could ever happen to me.
The most amazing things in life usually happen on the other side of moments like that, moments that try to break us down. Although our lives begin to fill with fear and confusion, those moments can turn into something great—absolute new beginnings, if you let it.
Not only did my layoff allow me to explore the other options that were available to me as I started down a new path in life as an entrepreneur, but it taught me the most important call-to-action all of us need to practice in order to create purposeful change in our lives:
To let go.
I had to let go of who I thought I was supposed to be—the years of architecture school, my career path, and my parents' example.
I had to let go of the fear that I wasn't qualified or skilled enough to become an entrepreneur, and I was worried about what others were going to say about me in the process.
This book, this campaign, is a call-to-action to anyone looking to create a new path in their life.
You must learn how to LET GO, because you cannot possibly start climbing a new ladder if you're still holding onto the old one.
 June 17 is my Let Go Day, and I celebrate it every single year. This being the 10-year anniversary of this special day, I wanted to do something really cool.
This campaign is my way of celebrating this 10-year milestone and sharing my excitement about the launch of the Special Edition of Let Go—a beautifully designed coffee table book—with my audience and fans.
The celebration includes a slate of special rewards, from incredible deals on the digital, audio, and hardcover versions of Let Go, to once-in-a-lifetime VIP experiences!
I’ve set up the campaign so that you’ll find something amazing at whatever level you wish to contribute.
You see, this is more than just a book about my story. It’s a call-to-action to YOU, an instruction manual to help you through life's tough times, and a reminder of the most important idea for anyone looking to grow: Let Go.
You can check out the reward tiers on the right, or scroll down to get the details of all the rewards.
And for those of you who picked up a digital copy of the expanded edition of the book when it first came out in August 2017, a special THANK YOU! You’re going to love the amazing print edition we’ve created.
A Beautiful Coffee Table Print Book—and So Much More!
The version of Let Go coming out this summer is extra special. Finally, the book gets a print release. But not just that—it has an elegant hardcover treatment, replete with gorgeous interior illustrations and a design I’m incredibly proud of. Plus, a limited number will come in a special edition, individually numbered and signed by me. This special signature edition also comes with a customized sleeve to protect your book, too.
Illustration treatment from artist.
This Kickstarter is your chance to get your hands on a copy of the expanded edition of Let Go in digital, audio, hardcover, or signature edition.
But this campaign is about way more than that too!
I’m opening up some of the reward tiers for a few opportunities that rarely come around—including some that have never been made available to the general public.
In fact, a select few of the upper-tier rewards include a chance to spend some quality time with me in various ways.
And here’s the thing I’m the most excited about: one of the reward tiers includes a VIP ticket to my first ever live conference, which will be happening in the summer of 2019. It’s going to be an amazing experience, and I’m making 100 tickets available via this campaign.
I’ve never done anything quite like this before, and I’m so excited to share this book, and this lineup of amazing rewards with you.
Here’s a rundown of all the great stuff and experiences you can get your hands on in this campaign:
The digital version of Let Go (ePub, mobi, PDF)
The Let Go audiobook, plus bonus videos and digital mobile and desktop wallpaper
The print Special Edition of Let Go
The print Limited Signature Edition of Let Go (signed and numbered limited edition)
Access to Smart From Scratch, my hands-on, comprehensive online course that has already helped thousands of people develop and validate their own business ideas
Tickets to my first ever live conference in summer 2019 in beautiful San Diego, California, along with front row seats and a VIP dinner with me
A fun group day with me in San Diego, California
A private 60-minute one-on-one call with me via Skype or Zoom
A virtual keynote or presentation by me to your team or group
An in-person keynote or presentation by me to your team or group
A full-day one-on-one with me in San Diego
The Reward Details
Now that you’ve got the full scoop on all the awesome details of the campaign and rewards, I’d like to tell you a little more about my story and this book…
Learning to Let Go
Let Go is my story about overcoming adversity through a commitment to pursuing my own path, and it's a story that has been shared before, but never like this.
I've told my story several times on podcast interviews and on TV before, but the first time I really wrote about the deep emotions that came after my layoff was in 2012 in a simple blog post. 
The response to that post was incredible, and my audience wanted more details about what exactly happened and how I was able to survive and thrive.
People were asking questions like:
What did April (my fiancée) think after she heard the news?
How did my parents react?
How did I really transition from depression to entrepreneur, and what steps did I take?
So, I wrote a small book—the first edition of Let Go back in 2013—which was simply published on Kindle. It happened to become a bestseller in a few categories on Amazon, which was an amazing thing to see.
A few years later, I published an updated version with a lot more stories and lessons learned since becoming a successful entrepreneur—because the truth is that I've had to learn to let go of even more things to continue to grow my business and raise a family, too.
As I once heard, "What got you here won't get you there."
Through it all, I’ve learned the power of letting go—of fear, of limiting beliefs, of things that may have worked in the past but don’t work anymore—in order to let in growth and abundance.
I want to help you let go of what's holding you back, and this book, and the corresponding reward levels, can help you do that.
I'm excited to see this book and the call-to-action boldly displayed on the cover on your bookshelf or at your desk to remind you daily that you need to remember to let go in order to grow.
I'm excited to potentially see some of you in person at my group events, or even my big first conference next year.
And most of all, I'm excited to one day hear about your story, and hopefully the role that this book played in it. 
Choose the reward level that makes the best sense for you, and I can't wait to deliver this to you later this year! The campaign will help with the production costs, as we wanted this to be a higher-end piece that you can proudly display in your home or office. 
Additionally, if you're looking to start an online business of your own one day soon, I'd suggest the "No Brainer Level," which gives you access to my online course Smart from Scratch, which has a normal retail price of $247. 
You get this book, AND the course, at the $147 pledge level, so if you're looking for help to determine what your business should be about, or how to narrow down all of your ideas to one good one you can move forward with, the "No Brainer Level" is the right one for you.
Thanks again. I appreciate you! Cheers!
What People Have Been Saying About Let Go
“In this world of hype and hyperbole comes an author courageous and compassionate enough to deliver authentic hope. True, Pat's story is chock-full of emotion, but it's also sprinkled with entrepreneurial lessons along the way. You'll find yourself captivated by the larger plot taking shape and you'll soon realize that your life mimics the same potential for impact. All of this begins when you're willing to LET GO.” —Kary Oberbrunner
“Learning to let go is a pattern on the path to success, as Pat clearly points out in his book. From comparing yourself to others to starting to act like a real CEO… this book helps me look at each letting go moment as a big win. I could really relate to all the self-doubt that even the amazing Pat Flynn experiences. Thanks for keeping it real, Pat. It's nice to know you are human just like me.” —Adrianne Meldrum
About Pat Flynn
Pat Flynn is an acclaimed thought leader in the areas of online entrepreneurship, digital marketing, and lifestyle businesses. He overcame career adversity at an early age by finding his own path and true passion. Despite his success in business, Pat’s greatest joys are spending time with his family and friends as well as helping inspire and educate others on how to succeed with their own entrepreneurial careers.
Since 2014, however, he’s become more interested in areas of philanthropy, specifically in the world of education. He is on the advisory board for Pencils of Promise, and has helped build schools in Ghana, Africa. He plans to use his success to help education locally, a passion of his now especially since his two young children are now of school age.
Pat is routinely praised for his authentic leadership style and business principles. Forbes recently named him one of the ten most transparent leaders in business. The New York Times profiled him as a case study in smart online business building. And countless podcasts and blogs have featured his story and the techniques he uses to manage and grow this audience.

campaign.story:
What is I Am a Blogger?
In the past, creators only had a few options to earn a living doing what they loved:
Set up shop in their city or town
Take their work on the road
But now, instead of being limited to a single town or taking the show on the road, they can set up shop on the web and attract the right customers from all over the world.
We’ve spent the last year traveling to find some of the most interesting and unique creators driving this change.
Now we’re telling those stories in the form of nine short documentary films and a beautiful coffee table book featuring 17 total stories.
This Kickstarter project will help fund the completion of the project and deliver it right to your doorstep.
If you’re a creator who’s always hoped for a better way to explain how you earn a living… If you’re the kind of person who loves supporting independent creators with your hard earned dollars… Or if you hope to earn a living as a creator yourself some day…
We made this project for you. And we call it: I Am a Blogger.
For too many people, blogger is a derogatory term. For us as creators, it’s a word that explains how we earn a living from our work, so we’re taking the word back and re-defining it with this project.
Reward Tiers 
To support the project, you can contribute at one of the following levels (some of which are incredibly limited!):
Pledge $25 or more and you'll get a digital copy of the book, a free month trial of ConvertKit (email marketing software for creators), and early access to all nine documentaries.
Pledge $75 or more and you'll get two physical copies of the coffee table book, a signature "Create Every Day" sticker, and everything in the previous tier.
Pledge $150 or more and you'll get five physical copies of the coffee table book instead of two, plus everything in the previous tier.
Pledge $500 or more and you'll be listed as a patron in the credits of the book and each documentary; you'll also get everything in the previous tier.
Pledge $1,000 or more and you'll get a ticket to Craft + Commerce, ConvertKit's annual conference in Boise, Idaho for professional creators; you'll also get everything in the previous tier.
Pledge $10,000 or more and we'll book an awesome location in your city, fly members of our team in on a date of your choice, and host a private screening of all nine short documentary films for 50 of your closest friends. 
We'll also host a private business mastermind with our top strategic thinkers for you and 10 friends while we're in town. Plus, you'll get everything included in the previous tier.
Help us bring this project to life and make a pledge toward your favorite tier!
What this Project Will Fund 
This project will fund:
The final editing and production of nine short documentary films, each ranging from five to nine minutes in length
The editing, design, and first print run of the coffee table book.
Overview of the Project
The internet has enabled some of the most talented and interesting people in the world to make a living in a way that was never possible before — we call those people creators.
In the past, a creator — whether a magician, fitness trainer, recording artist, teacher, author, photographer, or other fascinating professional — only had a few options to earn a living doing what they loved:
Set up shop in their city or town and hope there’s enough of a customer base to earn a decent living 
Take their work on the road to find customers wherever they might be
But now, instead of being limited to a single town or taking the show on the road, they can set up shop on the web and attract the right customers from all over the world.
This is creating huge changes in the way the world of work works:
It’s easier than ever before for a talented creator who’s honed their craft to earn an honest living doing work they love 
Getting a traditional “job” has become just one option for earning a living
Many people find that they can earn more money and have more fun as an independent creator 
Everyone else benefits from the products and services being built by these creators
We’ve spent the last year traveling to find some of the most interesting and unique creators driving this change.
Now we’re telling those stories in the form of nine short documentary films and a beautiful coffee table book featuring 17 total stories.
This Kickstarter project will help fund the completion of the project and deliver it right to your doorstep.
If you’re a creator who’s always hoped for a better way to explain how you earn a living… If you’re the kind of person who loves supporting independent creators with your hard earned dollars… Or if you hope to earn a living as a creator yourself some day…
We made this project for you. And we call it: I Am a Blogger.
For too many people, blogger is a derogatory term. For us as creators, it’s a word that explains how we earn a living from our work, so we’re taking the word back and re-defining it with this project.
The Documentaries
When we started this project in late 2016, the craziest thing we could think of was traveling all over the country to meet creators in their homes to tell their stories.
Over the course of four months, we did just that as we took four trips to film 90-120 minute interviews with nine different creators across seven cities.
We spent the rest of the day with each creator filming their lives — from their favorite workouts, to getting the kids in bed, to making snacks for baseball practice.
The outcome: nine short films ranging from five to nine minutes capturing the emotional journey of making a living as a blogger.
The Coffee Table Book
Where the documentaries serve to share the emotional arc of each creator’s journey, the coffee table book dives into detail to capture exactly how it all happened along the way.
Beyond the nine creators featured in the short films, we also sat down for long-form audio interviews with eight more creators.
We’ll tell all 17 stories in the book with engaging prose, data-driven graphics, and stunning photography.
You can expect to learn:
Why they care about their work so much 
How they got started 
How they built an audience 
When they decided to create their first product or service 
The biggest struggles and triumphs on the way to earning a full-time living 
How their business earns money today 
Their biggest personal and professional lessons learned from earning a living as a creator
But more than anything, you can expect this book to represent why your story as a creator matters. Why being a creator - a blogger, a podcaster, a YouTuber - is one of the most fascinating and rewarding ways to earn a living today.
The Creators 
This project features 17 inspiring creators spread across many different industries, skillsets, and cities. Some will be featured in the short films and written stories, while others will be featured solely in written stories.
These creators are:
Asad Chaudhry - Magic - 52Kards.com 
Barron Cuadro - Men’s Fashion - EffortlessGent.com 
Brooke Schoenman - World Travel - HerPackingList.com 
Chad Collins - LEGO and Events - BrickFestLive.com 
Corey Willis - Interior Design - HeyThereHome.com 
Courtney Slazinik - Photography - ClickItUpaNotch.com 
Crosby Noricks - Fashion and Public Relations - PRCouture.com 
Dave Stuart - Teaching - DaveStuartJr.com 
The Fantasy Footballers - Fantasy Football - TheFantasyFootballers.com 
Jean Van’t Hul - Art and Parenting - artfulparent.com
Joshua Becker - Minimalism - BecomingMinimalist.com 
Krista Stryker - Fitness - 12MinuteAthlete.com 
Mique Provost - Creativity and Home Making - ThirtyHandmadeDays.com 
Patty Palmer - Art and Teaching - DeepSpaceSparkle.com 
Sarah Morgan - Online Business - XOSarah.com 
Tyler James - Comics - ComixTribe.com 
Vanessa Levin - Pre-K Teaching - Pre-KPages.com
A Preview of The Stories
To get a taste for what we’ll share in the films and coffee table book, here are a few of our favorite quotes from the long-form interviews:
“My audience is the one who told me I should have a business and I kept saying no. I was just putting content out there like bloggers do and somebody said, "I'd pay you for that if you could send it to me as an attachment." … They started asking more and more and wore me down. Finally, this little light bulb went off in the back of my head and I was like, "People would pay me for this? To do what I love? Really?" - Vanessa Levin, helping pre-school teachers keep the kids educated and entertained
“In order to get into [fashion] nowadays, you have to be a little bit different from everyone else. You can't just do a "what I wore today" blog, because there are millions of other people who are doing it. So, what is that thing that would make you a little bit different from the people who are already in the niche?” - Barron Cuadro, helping men dress with confidence and style
“I remember the day I made 12 cents and I was like, "Holy shit, you can make money doing this? Game on." - Corey Willis, helping you make your house feel more like home
“Teaching matters because all of human history is built on teaching. It's this constant investment in those who follow. So, teaching in the classroom matters a lot to me because it's my calling and I feel like I'm made to try to teach these kids about world history and life.” - Dave Stuart, helping teachers become better teachers
The Team Behind the Project
This project is created by the team at ConvertKit, where we’re on a mission to help creators earn a living.
ConvertKit is email marketing software for online creators - the authors, makers, chefs, photographers, YouTubers, teachers, artists and other creators building the future.
Email remains the #1 tool for building an audience and making a living online. If you believe in the importance of empowering creators to build the future, then you believe in the work we do at ConvertKit. 
We're a remote team of 30+ people in 24+ cities across 7 countries. We hire A-players and we believe in the power of great company culture to help us grow.
We've partnered with the phenomenal team at Caleb Wojcik Films, who shot all of the video for this project. We also received help from our long-time writing partner, Kayla Hollatz, and a talented editor in Amanda Johnson.
We started this project because we believe creators are the future, we want to help tell the stories of the creators building that future, and now we need you to help us finish it. 
Choose your favorite tier and make a pledge to bring I Am a Blogger to life!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We'll need to create the coffee table book and video documentaries. Both of these are already underway, and the funds from this project will help us get across the finish line. 

We already have the full team in place to help edit, produce, design, and print the documentary films and coffee table book.

The biggest risk to this project would be our current print or video partners going out of business. We have contingency plans for quickly finding a new print or video partner if absolutely necessary, but we don't foresee this being an issue.

campaign.story:
Missed out on backing the Perfect Notebook?
  A notebook and a task manager designed to help you achieve your goals and work-life balance, using a four-step system: PLAN, ACT, MONITOR, REFLECT.
  STEP 1: PLAN.
Plan your "BIG BLOCK" goals for the next two-week cycle. 
A “BIG BLOCK” is a personal or professional task or goal requiring more than one day to complete, and can be broken down into a few daily tasks.
                   STEP 2: ACT.
         Add to your daily task manager a few small tasks that will get you closer to finishing A "BIG BLOCK" task.
Then, add all your other tasks to the daily task manager according to their priority. 
Now, act and complete your tasks.
    STEP 3: MONITOR. 
Cross completed tasks in the daily task manager and mark your progress in the "BIG BLOCKS" dashboard, and gain a visual graph of your focus for the period.
STEP 4: REFLECT. 
At the end of a cycle, use the REFLECTION page to learn how you can improve your next cycle.
Did you achieve your goals or not?
If yes, how will you maintain them? If no, how can you improve?
Why didn't you achieve your goals?
  Add, remove and rearrange pages any way you want using a modular disc binding system.
Refill based on your needs: task management, goal tracking, notebook pages and more.
Take pocket notes and add them to the notebook.
Use the two included rulers to bookmark what’s important. 
        The Perfect Notebook is a fully customizable notebook, packed with unique, highly effective, refillable productivity tools (90 pages, 180 sheets):  
       Each add-on or refill cost is $7. Some rewards include 3 refills of your choice at a discounted price, but you will also be able to add any add-on once we send out the BackerKit survey.
         30 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the Perfect Notebook community. Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who could use an excellent productivity tool!
              Why do we so often fail on the tasks that matter to us the most? This is a question asked and answered by Prof. Dan Ariely in several articles and research documents. 
We followed Prof. Ariely’s guidelines when we designed our BIG BLOCKS system, which is included in The Perfect Notebook.
Dan Ariely is a Professor of Psychology & Behavioral Economics at Duke University, as well as the author of the New York Times bestsellers Predictably Irrational, The Upside of Irrationality, The Honest Truth About Dishonesty and Pay Off. 
    The Perfect Notebook never runs out: 
Buy only ONE and keep refreshing it with our refills.
Manage weight and bulkiness: remove and archive pages you are done with, add new ones and start creating new ideas.
Opens 360 degrees to save desk space. 
What could be better than a notebook you can customize to your particular sense of order?
The Perfect Notebook is not a planner, but a task manager. 
The Perfect Notebook uses the daily task pages as a unique feature that allows you to incorporate "BIG BLOCK" tasks everyday, parallel to regular day-to-day tasks.
  While many applications for time management exist, none can replace the added value of sitting down with a pen and paper. It’s just faster, way more convenient, and therefore you will actually use it. 
Here is what Amy Schellenbaum, Popular Science, had to say:  
“Writing things down can make you feel better, mentally and physically.”  
“...Once you’ve written down all the tiny things you need to get done, you give your brain the capacity and the encouragement to actually do the things.”  
“The manual effort: It’s easy to underestimate the swell of satisfaction from making progress on something physical. To-do lists give nerds like me the thrill of checking something off. It’s a genuinely pleasurable experience.”  
   “A lot of tech people I know are going back to paper, because a paper planner … there’s still no better tool than a paper planner.” organization and time-management guru, David Allen, said during a recent Wired.com interview.
    Select your preferred reward tier (your card will only be charged at the end of the campaign). 
Choose the accessories and refills that fit your needs. 
At the end of the campaign, we will send you a BackerKit survey, which will allow you to finalize your order, change reward tiers, select more than one reward tier and customize your order with add-ons. Extra shipping rates may apply, depending on your selection(s).
    We put a lot of thought into the design of the Perfect Notebook to make sure it would be both effective and beautiful. 
Color Palette - the Perfect Notebook couldn’t just use black ink. We tested many colors and shades and finally opted for a color palette which used the the classical Montblanc Leo Tolstoy ink as reference. This beautiful ink shade, printed on a thick, 90 g/gqm, cream colored paper just looks great.
 Blue color shades used across The Perfect Notebook:
However, color is not just about looks. We decided to use colors as a simple and intuitive prioritization tool in the daily task pages. 
The mechanism is simple - darker blue equals high priority. Lighter blue equals lower priority:
        Design: Oren Fait | www.orenfait.com
Video: Yawaradi Studio | www.yawaradi.com
Layout: Maia Lichtenstein

Some obvious new or first time backers here. To clarify, you are funding the project itself. Not the actual product. The receipt of the product is a result of your funding and the use of those funds by the designers. Timing and delays are commonplace here. I have funded projects that projected a 6 month delivery time and didn't receive the product until over a year later. This can be disheartening to those that have never participated in a Kickstarter campaign but rest assured, in my experience, the delays in production were well worth the wait. Here, if IV actually delivers the PDFs in a "week or early next week," assume that that's without any unforeseen issues that arises. Patience is an absolute virtue here. I've backed 71 projects and I don't think I have ever received one by the time stated in the reward tier. And, I only haven't received one project which cost $5 and thats because I forgot to fill out the survey and didn't follow up. I hope this offers any new people here some solidarity. NOTE: This isn't to say that if you back a project and the developer is not communicating progress to you that you should wait and do nothing. Send messages and ask questions and demand communication (while keeping the above in mind) if you feel you aren't getting necessary updates on a particular project. Remember its in the developers best interest to communicate with you and provide you with updates and finally a product you are happy with if they want backers for future campaigns.
Thank you for keeping us updated!

EASE TENSIONS IN NECK & SHOULDER!
           C-REST creates ultimate relaxation in your neck and shoulder anytime anywhere. C-REST helps you relieve stress, rest better and feel refreshed.
C-REST is an intelligent, personal massager. You do not need to ask your friends or husband/wife to get that STIFF SPOT (what some people call it, "Knot"). 
It is easy to use anywhere—in offices, hotels, car (obviously not while driving), public transportation, and more.
 JUST REST ON C-REST
It's very simple. Just REST on C-REST. We are busy and tired everyday.
Before bed, rest on C-REST to release stress and tension. Start your morning refreshed with C-REST. Rest comfortably in effortless perfect posture.
Move side to side. If your friends cannot massage there, C-REST can get that SPOT for you!
       C-REST massages these muscles, called NECK EXTENSORS: Trapezius,  Nuchal Line (& Ligament), Splenius Capitis, Spleinius Cervicis, etc.! 
Use C-REST while sitting
Yes. You can use C-REST while resting on a chair. It will help stimulate the "occipital muscles." By stimulating these muscles, it relaxes occipital nerves and increases circulations to your eyes.
We need C-REST for our "tech neck"
  She loves it. You will love it, too.
           C-REST is designed to support the cervical spines in the most ergonomic way. Every grove and knob have been carefully designed.
One Size Fits All* (*Except for Kids)
IT'S MADE BY PROS:
The initial idea came from a hair designer who always had tensions and pain in neck and shoulder. She also funded our dream initially. Oriental Medicine Doctor & Chiropractor, who specialise in pain medicine, started to design with the help of 3D designers and manufacturers. Although we all came from the different background, our common goal has always been the same: "Help as many people as possible so that they can educate & benefit the others in return." 
 HIGHLIGHTS
C-REST relieve stress & tension – instead of spending hundreds of dollars on massage and spa to release daily stress, you can just rest on C-REST. Lightweight and portable. You can throw C-REST in your purse or backpack or share it with your family members.
Next gen neck support – the keystone to good posture is the neck. Traditional neck supports only focus on your curvature of the cervical spine, but C-Rest also relieve tensions in neck muscles as well. Neck extensor muscles stabilizes your cervical spines, restoring your natural curvature, and provides neck support.
10 minutes a day – Rest on C-REST for as little as 10 minutes a day to relieve tensions on neck muscles and achieve great posture when you stand or sit on your own.
BONUS FEATURES
One Size*
Comfortable: honest to goodness support and relief 
Effortless: just rest on it; no professional knowledge needed.
Reliable: 100% tech free (no battery) 
You know that feeling of weight on your shoulder at the end of the day. C-REST is designed to relieve that in about 10 minutes. 
Good posture has been proven by researchers to boost your mood, motivation, concentration, metabolism, immune system, confidence and more!

campaign.story:
WE DID IT!
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for following us on this journey and backing The Purpose Hotel. This project was so different for the Kickstarter community. We’re not selling a product; we’re sharing a big idea. 
You responded in such a huge way. Because of your generosity and backing, we’ve raised our full stage 1 goal and some good design phase funds. This is a HUGE WIN!
To stay updated on our journey, sign up for updates at ThePurposeHotel.com. 
We’ll keep you updated every step of the way.
 But for now, it’s time to CELEBRATE!
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
JOIN US FOR OUR NEW CAMPAIGN!
Over the last month, we’ve shared with the world our vision for The Purpose Hotel. And we are overwhelmed with the response. Thousands and thousands of backers came together to show everyone that we can help make a change for the better.
New response has created a new opportunity for us. This is our new campaign and our new goal. Scroll down to “new things…” for all the details!
For those who are new to The Purpose Hotel idea, scroll down to “Introducing The Purpose Hotel” and join us!
New things are happening with The Purpose Hotel
We have dissected our budget to include the minimum of what we need to launch and get this project underway. Sure, we still hope we raise as much as we can, but by creating smaller goals, we can get started faster and maintain the flexibility we need to grow at the right pace. We’re launching this Kickstarter with a smaller incremental starting goal of $347,000. 
Reaching our goal of $347,000 allows us to complete our initial designs for the look and feel of our building and how it will look in the city of Nashville. At a minimum, this allows us to complete a financing package that will allow us to move forward with the project. We're excited that this first step is very achievable. But we still need your help to reach that goal. We have same perks and backer benefits as before. So if you’re returning, Welcome back and thank you for backing us again. If this is your first time here, Welcome and thank you! We need your help.
Introducing The Purpose Hotel
I've traveled the world for the past decade as a photographer, and every time I stay at a hotel, I can't help but think -- what if everything in this hotel was connected to a cause or a need?
Could a simple shift like that change the world? Imagine not just a hotel, but a global hotel chain, where every time you book a room: 
A child gets sponsored.
The internet fee fights human trafficking.
Every product (soap, shampoo, linens, furniture, curated art, specialty products) is purchased from partners who are making a difference. 
In the lobby, a clean water well symbolizes the flow of hope and life to everyone and everything connected to the hotel.
By choosing this hotel, you touch a hundred lives or more locally and internationally. You literally change the world in your sleep.
And that’s just the beginning. The design reimagines the hotel as a creative, interactive experience that ignites the imagination, promotes play and fosters community.
Frederick Buechner said, "[Purpose is] where your deep gladness and the world's deep hunger meet."
We aim to create a joy-filled space where this generation can come together and make awesome things happen.
It starts right now.
Let’s make history.
-jeremy
As seen in:
What the Press is Saying
   The Purpose Hotel features top-of-the-line products and materials that contribute to social good.
All good hotels provide a retreat – a respite – for its traveler. The Purpose Hotel goes farther: it connects you to something that’s bigger.
Simply put, people are the purpose.
Everything in the hotel is carefully considered with how it benefits others. By backing The Purpose Hotel, you become part of a larger movement.
1 for 100 Benefit Model
The goods and services that make a guest’s stay comfortable and luxurious help improve the quality of life for people around the world. Our design and operations teams strive to source items that maximize the number of people who benefit from the jobs it takes to create, manufacture and fulfill them.
A single stay doesn’t give just one person hope (which would be amazing in itself). We believe one night can elevate the circumstances of 100 lives or more.
Together, we can build a for-profit venture that creates opportunities for these partners to not only continue their amazing work, but to multiply it.
Build something that changes lives
We can build something that changes lives and becomes a defining mark of this generation. What will we be remembered for? We can leave a legacy of purpose, hope and freedom. (Or we can be known for Pokémon Go.)
The fuel behind it all will be you -- those who unite around the idea that a better way is possible.
And it’s going to be SO. MUCH. FUN.
This hotel will generate jobs and innovate opportunities for people who need it most, whether they live in the neighborhood or on the other side of the world.
By playing your part, you help make it all possible.
You may never be able to sponsor 300 children or build 40 wells or help hundreds of people escape a life of poverty or addiction.
But you can help us build a mechanism that can. When you back this idea, you become part of the very backbone of this movement.
You may never even want or have a need to stay at an actual Purpose Hotel, but you want to be part of the reason this movement exists. You want to do something tangible to fight against the injustice and sadness in the world.
This is it.
Become a co-founder
With your help, we can build a place where people can unite around causes we can all agree on: making sure everyone has access to clean water, education, jobs, and place to call home. We want to leave the world a better place.
The Purpose Hotel provides a way to secure your legacy.
Join this Kickstarter at the co-founder level and you become an agent of change. Your face will permanently be part of a special co-founders feature wall in every Purpose Hotel that we build, including our first in Nashville, Tennessee.
As a co-founder, you’ll be in on every step of the process. This is just the beginning – the ground level. We’re dreaming of Purpose Hotels dotting the map and eventually spanning the globe.
Let’s show the world what we can do together and build out this vision at a level never seen or imagined. We’re not just building a hotel chain; we’re innovating a business model that reimagines the hotel concept and allows hundreds of organizations to multiply their efforts and hundreds of thousands to fulfill their purpose -- including yours.
  The Process of Building a Hotel on the Internet.
Why crowdfund? Founded on the belief that what unites us is more powerful than the boundaries that divide us, The Purpose Hotel will be built communally on the internet. We’re not crowdfunding just because we need the money. We’re crowdfunding because it gives you a place in the process. The idea of this hotel being built for the world, by the world is a far more beautiful narrative than the traditional for-profit launch.
The Purpose Hotel is a rallying point. It’s a junction where community, justice, microenterprise, technology, art and design intersect.
 This hotel concept eliminates the need to agonize over which movements or causes to support. You become part of many of them.
Here’s what it’s going to take (besides copious amounts of caffeine and animated cat gifs).
Community managers to scout locations and rally support within cities and local communities
Accounts team to source all the design needs and partnerships
A design and engineering team to blueprint the building
An interior design team to craft a custom, boutique hotel experience
A hotel management team to reinvent guest services

Our Guide: Jeremy Cowart
Jeremy Cowart has spent the last 10 years photographing celebrities including Sting, Britney Spears, The Kardashians, Taylor Swift and more -- and stayed in hundreds of hotels. None of them left him inspired. So he began to reimagine the modern hotel.
Although he’s an entrepreneur at heart, he knew this hotel idea would be an enormous and ambitious undertaking. So he began telling people, one by one … People just like you. You responded. In a BIG way.
And not just you, but industry insiders, celebrities and some of the most influential business, religious and nonprofit leaders in the world.
He’s inviting all of us into this story.
Jeremy believes that as individuals, our influence is limited, but together, we’re about to see some amazing, incredible things happen...
Jeremy's Story:
   GOALS / STEPS
Help us meet and exceed our goal to build a strong foundation for The Purpose Hotel in Nashville, Tennessee. Here is how we'll use the funds: to design our hotel, make arrangements for our building and head toward the operations phase. This hotel will be a catalyst for change in a powerful and incredible industry that needs a breath of fresh air.
GOAL $347,000
Renderings / Development
Reaching our goal of $347,000 allows us to complete our initial designs for the look and feel of our building and how it will look in the city of Nashville. At a minimum, this allows us to complete a financing package that will allow us to move forward with the project. We're excited that this first step is very achievable. This step will stir excitement in our city and gain approvals for the hotel and its mark on Music City!
GOAL $347,000 - STEP 2 
Design and Architectural Planning
Our next step will be to execute the actual look and feel of the hotel's interior and exterior. Design/engineering planning will take place to discuss building efficiency and how it can be one of the most unique locations in Nashville. This design will place us on the map and turn heads as to a new standard for hotels. 
Hotel Features
Every product in The Purpose Store will have a cause and a story -- allowing guests to purchase beautiful accessories for their home and office while knowing that they’re helping families around the world improve their circumstances. The hotel will also feature:
Hallways and common areas filled with light and sound.
Rooms rich with textures and fine finishes, including one-of-a-kind handmade items.
An interactive TV feature where patrons can see and interact with all the organizations The Purpose Hotel is connected with. 
The Purpose Hotel staff will have the ability to contribute and share their own stories. They will be part of the experience and ongoing motivation of what this hotel is all about.
What will a guest experience look like?
When you arrive and check in, you automatically become a member of the community. Your receipt and online account show your individual impact and the collective influence of people choosing The Purpose Hotel. It adds up quickly.
Under the room number outside your door, you see a boy or girl who your room helps gives access to education, food, clothing and more.
Inside your room, you relax in a plush, modern place where you can learn about every object in the room and why it was selected. (See 1 for 100 model at the top of the page.)

Design of Hotel and Designed Backer Perks: The Purpose Hotel is directly responsible for the curation and custom design of every bit of the look and feel that goes into our brand and buildings. We design and source materials to fit a strict criteria and quality process. Your involvement NOW will make a difference immediately: From our first hour, we are raising funds here to attract the best of the best to build a hotel unlike the world has ever seen. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No one wants to see a good idea executed poorly, especially one that has a purpose as strong as ours. This idea has been incubated for four years. Nine months ago Jeremy began giving it legs, meeting with advisors and consultants and assembling teams to research and prepare the idea as a product for Kickstarter. Much diligence and many resources have been invested to get it to this point. However, we know a concept like this will have numerous challenges to bring it to full reality.

But here's what keeps us moving forward (and the reason we chose Kickstarter to fund the initial phase of this project): you have shown us overwhelming support. You, the community, along with industry outsiders and insiders, nonprofit partners, and leading voices from a variety of sectors continue to champion this idea and speak into it. We continually hear of ways to expand our vision beyond our first location. We have yet to hear from anyone who has a reason for us to believe this can’t become reality. But we temper our optimism with caution. We know the next 2-3 years (what we’re calling our studio phase) will be extremely difficult, but we are excited about assembling our "dream team" and taking the next necessary steps.

DREAM TEAM: The aim of this Kickstarter is to fund the first year of our studio phase, when we will attempt to raise the capital funding needed to bring this project to completion. This team will bring together the best design artists, international supply and finance, and hotel operators in the industry. Our finance team members have assured us that if we secure funding for our studio phase, we can put together a finance package that can build this hotel. We have a great pool of experts surrounding us from inside and outside the industry. There’s a quote attributed to Picasso that says, “Learn the rules like a pro, so you can break them like an artist.” That’s the approach we’re taking.

HOW LONG WILL THIS TAKE: This is going to be a 2-3 year process to build the first hotel. We will have a lot of fun along the way and involve our co-founders in every step of the process. We're already planning an awareness tour for The Purpose Hotel, and we're hopeful to launch our Purpose Store online almost immediately, so you can see the great products we are working into the hotel and have the opportunity to help these organizations and support us along the way.

SOURCING / PARTNERS: We know one of our biggest challenges will be in procuring enough goods that meet our stringent requirements to supply our ongoing operations. But we’ve been encouraged in our meetings with dozens of social good and not-for-profit entities on how we may source materials and continuously ensure quality-control. We already have a first-rate Furniture, Fixtures and Equipment (FF&E) team and award-winning design team to help build the building in place.

CONSTRUCTION: We are less concerned with the construction to operations phase because we have plenty of top partners who are eager to work with our project. We do have challenges finding the right property. Having funds in hand to pay cash (or mostly cash) for property will give us great leverage with owners and city planning managers.

GIVING BACK: Once our project is out of the ground, and we are operating as the first Purpose Hotel, we will have more ability to generate profit and give back in a direct way (but from day one we’ll source from and partner with organizations who are helping those in need). There is quite a bit of risk of getting us there. However, we believe the large support network of organizations we’re partnering with will drive our operation toward reality. They’ve done so much of the leg work over the years and are helping us find vendors who will supply materials in a sustainable, non-traditional and social conscious way. Together, we’re working to ensure every link in the supply chain can support and grow with us.

PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: We will continue to refine our process during our studio phase, and strengthen our hotel operations plan. This may bring adjustments to our model, the products we offer, and even the cities we will launch hotels in, but every decision will carefully weigh how it affects others. People are the purpose. We’ll never make a change for the sole purpose of boosting profits or making a name for ourselves. We’ll do everything in our power to keep our partners, the people we’re helping, our staff, our guests and our co-founders’ best interests at the forefront. And we’ll keep you, the founding members, up-to-date on exactly what and why changes were made. We believe accountability is key.

FULFILLMENT: Sometimes things go awry that can’t be planned for, such as a supplier missing a deadline, a machine breaking down, a shipment getting lost or even a natural disaster. Anything can cause a delay. To minimize the possibility of delivery setbacks, we have already vetted the supply chain and ensured the delivery of products for our Kickstarter backers. We aim to begin delivering these November 2016.

We are working with experienced manufacturers who have a passion and track record for delivering excellent products. Because the products being curated for The Purpose Hotel are in limited quantities and custom batches, there will no doubt be some surprises along the way. But we’re confident we can address any obstacle by combining our internal knowledge with external expertise. We’re not going to sweat it. Plus, there’s always the option of stress eating. Chips and guac, anyone?

Any pledge amount adds critical momentum and brings us one step closer to our goal. Help us make The Purpose Hotel a reality by clicking the "Back This Project" button at the top of the page. Help us spread the word by sharing our page and telling your friends!

THANK YOU for believing in The Purpose Hotel. We can’t wait to see you there!

campaign.story:
THANK YOU.
I couldn't have done it without you. You made this happen. The amount of support, encouragement, and enthusiasm about the Volt Planner has been overwhelming. I cannot wait to get these planners in your hands and see all the incredible things you'll be able to accomplish in 2017. 
I backed the Kickstarter. What are next steps?
Thanks for your pledge! We will be sending out a survey at the close of the project to gather your shipping address. Please be on the lookout for the survey and get it back to us so we know where to ship your book! Expected ship date is the first week of December, likely sooner. We'll share more shipping info in the backer updates. 
I missed the campaign--is it too late to get a Volt Planner? 
It's never too late! :) We have the 2017 Volt Planner available for preorder on our website. Be sure to check out the site--you might just see something else you love. 
I pledged for the digital PDF version of the planner. When will I receive it?
We will be sending out the PDF a couple weeks after the campaign ends. If you missed the campaign and are looking for the PDF, we will have it available for sale on our website in a couple weeks. 
I'm interested in the limited edition custom cover for the planner--is there any way to get one?
Yes! We sold out of covers so quickly on the Kickstarter but we're already making more. You can find them for sale on our website--they're not quite ready yet so be sure to check back when this page goes live (hopefully in a few weeks).  
I really enjoyed the updates, especially the worksheets and tips & tricks. How can I get more?
Stay up-to-date with announcements, advice, and more by signing up for our newsletter. Go to our website and scroll to the bottom to sign up! 
Thank you for a great campaign. Keep on shining, superstar. 
HOW WOULD IT FEEL TO ACCOMPLISH EVERY SINGLE GOAL YOU SET OUT FOR YOURSELF THIS YEAR?
How successful could you be if you weren't slowed down by day-to-day distractions, and started making real, tangible progress on your most important work and goals?
If you’re tired of always feeling like you’re farther behind than you want to be, and you’re ready to start accomplishing the things you truly want to do to move your career and your life forward, then you need the Volt Planner.
Designed and delivered by the same team that brought you the incredibly popular Spark Notebook and Spark Planner, the 2017 Volt Planner takes the very best goal-setting, planning, and personal organization tools from those planners and bundles them into a full year of laser-focused amazing success and productivity. 
You don't need to be perfect or have superpowers to be successful. You just need the right tools. Anyone can be amazing. You can be amazing.
The Volt Planner is sleek, professional, and designed to make you more successful. We have taken the science of setting and achieving your goals and wrapped it into one beautifully designed planner - and you won't want to start your year without it.
With the Volt Planner, success is always at your fingertips.
Over the course of my career, I have worked with some of the smartest, most successful people in the world. From my time as a software engineer at big companies like Microsoft and Amazon to my time as a Chief Technology Officer at successful startups like Moz and Decide, to sitting on boards of international organizations, I have seen one thing time and time again:
The most successful people in the world are always organized and put together.
They rely on targeted goals, smart planning, and deep, focused work to accomplish amazing things. I’ve learned so much about how to be amazing from these people, and now I want to share this proven system to help you be more successful too.
Two years ago I launched a Kickstarter to produce a goal-setting and note-taking system called the Spark Notebook. We were able to share the notebooks with people all over the world - it was amazing to create something that made so many people more successful and productive. 
Here we are today, over 30,000 books later. We've shipped to thousands of people and were overwhelmed with inspiring success stories and lots of encouragement to keep the goodness coming year after year.
You've got your goals--mine is to take these proven planning tools and give them to you in one planner that you can use to make 2017 your best year yet.
Research has shown that people who write down their goals — and who review those goals regularly — experience more success than those that don't.
I wanted to create a place where goal-setting could be beautifully simple and powerfully effective.
In the Volt Planner, you’ll find smart, simple, easy-to-use layouts that will help you stay on track every day, all day. This planner takes those big, complex goals and turns them into accomplishments by breaking them down into manageable tasks. After just one week, you'll feel like you're actually getting somewhere and will be one step closer to success.
Take a look at the images below to get a feel of how beautiful (and functional) these pages are:
YEARLY THEME & ACHIEVEMENTS
Great things come to those who plan for them. Lay out your great plans and big dreams, and keep a record of what you achieve and when.
MONTHLY GOALS & 30-DAY CHALLENGES
Track your monthly goals and challenge yourself to create (or break) a habit. Success is *all* about consistency.
MONTHLY CALENDARS
Monthly calendar spreads so you can keep track of all your important dates, reminders, and appointments.
WEEKLY GOALS & WEEKLY JOURNALING PROMPTS
Each week there is a place to recognize your progress, learn from your mistakes, and plan how you'll keep going. And of course plenty of blank, flex space to be used for your big thoughts and grand ideas.
WEEKLY OUTLOOK
A weekly outlook designed for time blocking - that way you can plan your day and always know you are working on something that matters.
HAND-CRAFTED AND ARTFULLY BOUND TO LIE FLAT NO MATTER WHAT
Each book is put together by hand. This isn't just a planner; it's also design, a craft, a work of art. We use a special binding so the planner lies flat, no matter what page you are on.
---
The Volt Planner has the following layouts:
Yearly Theme & Goals - you need to set direction
Annual Achievement Tracker - so you can celebrate all the great things you do next year 
Monthly Overview (12 months) 
Monthly Goals (1 for each month) 
30 Day Challenge (1 for each month) 
Weekly Goals - prioritize and strategize so all of your work matters 
Weekly Overview - designed for time blocking to help you make the most of every single day 
Weekly Inspiration Prompts - these are designed to get you thinking, but also designed to be mostly blank so you can fill them with great ideas, fantastic drawings or plans for your next big thing.
In addition to the useful design, you’ll also discover these other great features:
Made in the USA. I’m proud to send something to you made in the country where I live. 
Two-page markers. You’ll never have to worry about losing your place. 
A luxurious and sophisticated cover. I want this planner to feel and look sophisticated so we have tested all kinds of cover materials and picked one we know you will love. 
High quality, ink-proof, acid-free paper. No more ink bleeding through pages. Fountain pen safe (I’ve tested it myself!). 
Special lay-flat binding. These books are hand-sewn and designed with a very special binding that allows you to write easily on every page - front and back. 
Environmentally sound. We use soy based inks for printing. We use rainforest friendly paper. Everything is produced where we know the labor and manufacturing practices are to the same high standards as our products. 
Over 250 pages. We have designed each page to be clean, simple and flexible. 
 5.75” x 8.25” size. A perfect size for at your desk or in a meeting.
During my entire career as an entrepreneur and executive, I've struggled to find a notebook that had the functionality I needed that I also wouldn't be embarrassed to carry into a board meeting.
It seemed like the only notebooks with goal-planners, journaling pages, and organization systems were bright pink and looked like a scrapbook. Not exactly what I was looking for to be taken seriously.
On the other hand, though, the sleek, modern notebooks I found lacked all functionality and served only as appointment books or calendars. They were just lined pages with no system for notes, goal-setting, or effective planning. 
The search for the perfect, professional notebook left me wondering: Why is it so hard to find a notebook with tons of functionality and a beautiful, professional design?
So I built my own. I launched the Spark Notebook as a Kickstarter two years ago and the Spark Planner last year. Once the notebooks were delivered to thousands of people across the globe, feedback came pouring in.
I heard again and again from users who wished for two things: 
A full year of pages 
Fewer notes pages and more planning pages 
I listened, and that's exactly what I want to give you with the Volt Planner. Tons of functionality, a full year of amazing planning and goals, and no distractions from your biggest dreams and accomplishments.
With the Volt Planner, you can achieve any goal. You can make anything happen.
Accomplishing amazing things isn't about being superhuman. It's not about being perfect. It's about having the right tools, the right system, and the right plan.
The Volt Planner helps you put all those things right in one place, and a place that's so artfully designed you'll want to have it with you all the time — and your coworkers will ask you where they can get one too.
No more wishing you could accomplish more every day, or feeling at the end of the year like you could have done more if you'd only worked harder.
With the Volt Planner, you can look any goal in the face and know you'll achieve it. You'll look back on every year and be amazed by what you've accomplished.
I want you — and your ideas — to be heard. I want you to walk into your next meeting as the person everyone else wants to listen to, the person so organized and on top of things that everyone turns to you first. I want you to get more from your career and the things in life that leave you feeling accomplished and proud.
I want you to do everything you want to do. I want you to wow your boss, coworkers, and clients with how incredibly productive and effective you are. I want you to feel proud and accomplished. And I know the Volt Planner can help you get there.
If you want that too — if you want to show 2017 what you're truly capable of— then please pledge now so we can build The Volt Planner and make being achieving your goals in 2017 a beautiful reality.

campaign.story:
***Now available in UK! (Click here for instructions)
Tired of telemarketers calling your landline or mobile? I'm sorry to say, they will never, ever stop. And no amount of screaming "take me off your list", or "he doesn't live here", or "I will never buy your product" will make these calls go away. 
But now there is a way to fight back.  The Jolly Roger Telephone Co. provides a friendly, agreeable, patient robot that talks to these rude telemarketers for you. It is happy to chat, and will typically keep an unwary salesperson engaged for several minutes.
These merciless organizations have technology on their side with robotic auto-dialers, robotic soundboards, and an array of other tools ...but they have no morals. Their weak spot is that they need human agents to talk to you when you answer. So the only way to stop this intrusive industry is waste their precious human resource - to hit them in the cost of labor. Now by subscribing to the Jolly Roger Telephone Co. you can get revenge! 
In order to accomplish this, we need to build the infrastructure to allow "Us" - the consumers - to fight back. We need telephone systems, we need telephone numbers, and we need to pay pretty big phone bills to the carriers.
We are asking for funding to build the first version of a consumer-friendly monthly service so you can take back your telephone and return to a time when your phone was for you and your friends.
What will the product be?
Version one is a subscription service. Here's how it works:
You register for the service at our Jolly Roger web site and provide your email address and one or more telephone numbers you will be calling from.
You will be given a list of numbers for different robots (in different accents, different voices, different inane comments, male/female, etc.)
When an annoying telemarketer calls you, transfer them to one of our phone numbers (your favorite Jolly Roger Telephone bot). This bot will keep your telemarketer engaged as long as it can while you continue with your fun. 
When the call is complete, you will automatically be emailed a link to the recording and any other information we have been able to gather about who is calling. 
You will access the Jolly Roger Telephone web site to manage your account, review calls, download or share recordings, and a variety of other fun options.
Version 2 of the service will expand upon Version 1 to include the following:
You will be able to automatically forward your calls to Jolly Roger Telephone.
It will act as a call screener - automatically detecting telemarketers and sending them to your favorite robot but letting your friends and family get through to you or leave a message.
Just like any other answering machine ("voicemail" to the rest of you), you will be given the opportunity to record your own voice as the voice of the robot.
Does your robot work really well? Share it with the Jolly Roger community and have it take calls for other telemarketers. We will maintain a leader-board of which robots are working best at wasting telemarketers time.
Enhanced information about who the telemarketers were and what they were calling about will be made available on our web site.
Here is a quick breakdown of how the funding will be used:
$12k for Legal and Professional Services
$12K to complete Development 
$22K for Operations
We have a prototype up and running now where you can send your calls to our bot. 
Here is what Gizmodo.com is saying about this service
Recently featured on TheBlaze.com
Here is what they are saying at Reddit
Even our friends Down Under get annoying telemarketer calls (Sydney Morning Herald)
Please visit our Facebook page
Visit our YouTube channel to hear our bot in action
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any innovative technology project there are potential difficulties with scaling service offerings in a reliable and expedient manner, so we do expect to work hard to build and scale the infrastructure.

Our major risk is that at some point the established business interests in the Outbound Telemarketing industry notice the impact of our offerings and begin to fight back either by technical or legal means.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello Kickstarter backers!
Kickstarter has been kind enough to leave this campaign active and allow me to post updates. I am a fool for assuming that all you backers are aware of my progress through this incredible journey. If you want to follow along (and I'm flattered if you do!), the best way is to read my blog at www.jollyrogertelephone.com/blog, subscribe to my YouTube channel at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3OxCWLEmoIhNMm-hnvBm9Q, 'like' my Facebook page at  or follow me on Twitter at @jollyrogertelco. That's a lot of social media for a quiet introverted telephone guy like me.

updates.update_userinfo: Jolly Roger Telephone Company Launches Service to Disrupt Unsolicited Telemarketing
updates.update_content:
If you hate unsolicited telemarketing, please share this post from www.jollyrogertelephone.com! Share, like, tweet, email, react, whatever it takes. I really need your help to socialize this. We can disrupt unsolicited telemarketing. Reduce it. And maybe even stop it. But we need to work together.
For those of you who don't know me, I'm just an average guy. But I hate unsolicited telemarketing more than you do. I work on telephone systems for a living and I love telecommunications. I find unsolicited telemarketing extremely offensive - it congests the network I love so much with junk, scams, and spam. Many people are cancelling their landlines because of it, and that breaks my heart.

updates.update_userinfo: Reminder to new backers - you will NOT be charged for your pledge

One of the best compliments on Kickstarter was "This is the first time I have backed anyone."
One of the advantages for backers is that, if the Kickstarter campaign is not fully funded, then NOBODY PAYS. This is not always clear to first-timers.
So again, thank you everyone. That "$25,000 pledged" on the Kickstarter page looks great, but in five hours it will be over and, if not fully funded,. I look forward to seeing you on  as I roll out an extremely low cost annual subscription so we can get these unsolicited telemarketers back. Watch me at  or email me if you'd prefer email updates. Roger at JollyRogerTelephone dot com.

updates.update_userinfo: Controlled shutdown of this Kickstarter campaign
updates.update_content:
Hello all backers and interested parties. The Internet is full of "lessons learned from my Kickstarter campaign" postings, so I'll spare you all another one. I am mostly concerned about losing contact with you all since I will probably not have access to your email addresses in a few hours.
Thank for your recognizing the potential of this bot! Thank you for your interest in building more! Thank you for supporting a quiet, introverted telephone guy who just wants people to love their telephones again!

Hello especially to my new backers who have recently read about me in the San Francisco Chronicle, New York Times, or heard me on the radio (including All Things Considered on NPR) or even saw me on Good Morning America. I cannot believe I am writing these things. I'm just a quiet introverted telephone guy who only wants to work on phones. Ironically, my love of telephones is why I am so offended by unsolicited telemarketing. So I put my skills as a telephone guy to use by building a robot to talk to telemarketers.

Here's my dilemma.

telephones + marketing = telemarketing

I built a robot to thwart telemarketing. I'm kinda biased against it. But now I need your help to raise money to continue to thwart telemarketing. And I hate asking for money because I feel like a telemarketer. Do you see the position that I am in?

Turns out unsolicited telemarketing is a global problem.
One of the most difficult (and expensive) parts of this service was anticipated to be infrastructure, connectivity, and networking costs. I therefore planned this Kickstarter for the USA and figured I would build international as time and finances allowed.
I'm happy to say I will be able to get my USA costs below the initial budget. So you will soon see new pledge levels for the international community. I have met many new friends in the telecom industry and I have been able to find a sponsor for a UK number during this campaign! . The number is 0203-355-7498. campaign.story:
Pull the clip off binder, and find your card. No hidden nooks for things to get lost in.
The durable ABS plastic protects your cards from damage such as scratches, bending, and cracks.
Binder sits comfortable and compact in your pocket. You’ll hardly notice it. Due to its clever design, it won’t damage your clothing or the objects around it.
Binder is unaffected by water or sweat. Depending on what you keep in it, Binder is virtually waterproof.
Binder will hold any card, business card, note, ticket, or currency. Anything you can fold binder will hold.
Binder is Compact
Binder compacts currency and notes creating a uniform bundle that won’t shift in your pocket.
Colored Clip Option on Red
Binder came from my friend and my search for a better, thinner, and easier wallet. Expensive wallets, innovative wallets, well made wallets: none of them quite met the requirements. The leather would stretch, the Velcro was unfortunate, and the elastic would fatigue. Then someone suggested the office clip. It worked great! However, there were some small flaws, it didn’t protect the cards, it looked cheap, and the clip got stuck in pockets. So we set out to fix it. Through months of refinement, testing, CNC time, and tons of resin; Binder ended up as the product you see today.
Prototyping Binder
Color Options
  I have production set up ready to go, and am just waiting on the funds to purchase the first round of tooling. We have sourced the finest materials available and the wallet will be made in USA.
Lining up thousands of orders and shipping them successfully is a daunting task, but I have partners ready to help out if the load is larger than expected.
I am a design engineer based in Bellingham Washington. I’ve worked in renewables, design, and the chemical industry. I’ve really enjoyed designing this. I had an eighty-dollar leather wallet that I loved aside from its tendency to drop my ID on the floor occasionally. Binder has completely replaced it. I hope you enjoy using it as much as I do.
Graphic Design by Jolee Nebert, www.joleenebert.com
